properties.name: Austin Books
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedBest Comic Book Store ever! I\'m there every Wednesday (or Thursdays after a Monday Holiday). Come see me and I\'ll give you a free recommendation.

properties.name: Back when we played 'Giants'
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis was where my grandparents lived. We were here for Thanksgiving and Christmas every year, and at least once every few weeks to visit. We played giants, where we had to sneak past the parents without them seeing us. It was great.

properties.name: Beautiful mountain city
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis is a great city. It\'s filled with workers, students, and families. Downtown there is a great streetcar line that brings back thoughts of San Francisco, and the amount of bookstores and students makes one think that this is an Austin displaced in a different reality. I had one of my first real conversations in French here, with a guy that was selling sandwiches. The Alps are really wild around the city; instead of rolling magestically like the Rockies, they speed straight up like buildings in Manhattan. I really loved this city, even though I was just passing through. Bon travail Grenoble!

properties.name: Best meatloaf sandwiches this side of anything
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI love them, but at lunch the line is long. The smell of the sweet onions keeps me from going back to my car, and I\'m always glad they did.

properties.name: Blue House
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedAlong with Subash, Phil, and Grant, I lived in this dilapidated blue house during my last full semester in school (Fall 2005). It was pretty great, and the walk to campus was gorgeous. Negatives: toilet, general state of the bathroom, toilet, toilet, toilet. Positives: roommates, proximity to Speedway food mart and hooka bar, skateboarding, not walking up stairs, diagonal bed, hanging out at night.

properties.name: Chartres Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis is a beautiful cathedral. It\'s less crowded than the Notre Dame in Paris, and it really looks magnificent against the tiny village that sits against it.

properties.name: Comida Mexicana
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedRobbie and I like to eat here. It has all the freshness of interior mexican, with the familiar picks of Tex-Mex. I give it 7 stars (out of 4).

properties.name: Cozy Rusted Bridge
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedOn the way to school or work, or if you have to come by here, it\'s best to cross the creek with the help of this \'petit pont\'. It doesn\'t look like much, and that\'s the best part. It doesn\'t ask for much, just a visitor from time to time.

properties.name: Eat-In Sonic
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedMy girlfriend loves Houstons down the street, but for my money it doesn\'t get any better than this. When I was nine years old, I took a 2 month long trip with my grandparents. The day before I left, my mom took me out for an entire day of just fun stuff with her. The place I wanted to eat: the Eat-In Sonic. We sat down at a booth, picked up a telephone, and called our order in from inside the restaurant. It was the coolest thing ever, and I still love the idea of Eat-In Sonics.

properties.name: Eat-In Sonic
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedWhen I was nine years old I took a 2 month trip with my grandparents. The day before I left, my mom and I spent the entire day together, just doing fun things and such. This was the place I picked to eat. We walked in, sat down at the booth, picked up an old phone, and called "in" our order from where we were sitting. It was really really awesome and I still love the idea of Eat-In Sonics. That day, I also read "The Death of Superman" for the first time.

properties.name: Flat tire on the Saturn
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI blew out a tire one night coming home from work. It was a little after midnight, and as I was looking in the trunk for the spare tire, I felt some headlights behind me. I looked back and saw a car pulling up; it turns out it was just an older woman that wanted to make sure people driving past saw me on the side of the road, so she was just idling with her lights on.

properties.name: Great coffee place
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedÂ Phil introduced me to this treasure, and I\'ve been going ever since. It\'s a good place to study, the English Breakfast tea is amazing, and the chairs are just uncomfortable enough to make you concentrate on your studies - a real winner.

properties.name: History History History
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedIf you like History, both 20th and 9th century (and everything in between), this place is the spot. It was Charlemagne\'s home away from home, and the cathedral has great stuff from the Merovingian and Carolingian empires. The entire city is fortified with ancient walls, and you can even see areas of the city used as "last stands" during both World Wars. A restaurant down the street from the cathedral is even open on Sundays, although they mostly serve crepes, crepes, and crepes. The water is good though.

properties.name: Il y a beaucoup d'oeufs ici
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis place has good eggs for dinner. The coffee is good too.

properties.name: Limoges = ...
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedLimoges is French for the \'worst city in the world\'. If you\'re into history, you\'ll be interested to know that this was one of the high points in 19th century European labor disputes. The angry proletariate grabbed pitchforks, axes, and other gentille items, and marched through the streets in protest against the local porcelain and glassware factories. If you\'re not into history, all you need to know is that the place really hasn\'t changed. It\'s gross, dirty, depressing, and I can honestly say that it is the only place in France I wouldn\'t want to revisit. Sorry if you live here, maybe I didn\'t get a true picture of your city; my eyes just couldn\'t see past the truckstops, filled hotels, and werewolves.

properties.name: Mom's college house
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedMy mom lived here when she went to college. She was also living here when she first started dating my Dad, who delivered pizzas to her.

properties.name: Monday Night Soccer
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedÂ Following the frenzy of the World Cup, we started playing here every Monday night. They\'re redoing the grass now, but once the pitch is up and running again, so will we.

properties.name: Moore Hill - First Dorm
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis was the first dorm I ever lived in - it was the first place I ever lived w/o the parents. Moving in was fun, and 5 months later I got a new roommate, Andy, who turned out to be awesome.

properties.name: My Hotel in Paris
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedÂ This is where I stayed in Paris. The Latin Quarter is nice and relatively laid-back. You\'ll see that directly north is the Louvre and lots of other good stuff.

properties.name: My Training
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI\'ll be living here for three months, learning some more french, as well as a native language. Also, hopefully I\'ll be learning about trees.

properties.name: My first apartment
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI lived in this bad boy my first year out of the dorm. Besides being flanked by frat houses, it was really nice. It was up on stilts with cars beneath, so every morning over my bowl of cereal I\'d feel like I was in a treehouse. It might not have been classy, but it was as good as it gets.

properties.name: My sister lives around here.
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedShe lives far away from the rest of the fam, and while our cars break down on the way to San Antonio, she\'s sight-seeing and going to National Book Fairs.

properties.name: Parking at Austin High
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis is where I park when I go running on Town Lake. It\'s a good place to park, and my girlfriend went to high school here, so she always makes comments about all the new kids taking over her old stomping ground. Trust me, she did a lot of stomping.

properties.name: Robbin's Place Apt's
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI lived here for a year (2004-05) with Phil and Kassi. It was awesome, but overpriced, and I painted cave drawings on my bedroom wall and had to cover it when I moved out. Best things about the place: X-Men Legends, McDonald\'s Buckets of Nuggets, and Pre Downtown Hanging Out

properties.name: Robin's summer sojourn
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis is where Rob lived for a couple months this past summer. I don\'t know exactly where in the city, so I\'ll try to be more specific later.

properties.name: Springhill Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedÂ I worked here during high school. It was greasy and great.

properties.name: The Library
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedOn Thursday nights, we\'d often leave our free beers at our cozy, relatively quiet places and meet here, at a place that is pretty expensive, and so loud that you can\'t here your friend next to you.

properties.name: This cafe a ete tres magnifique!!
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedÂ Â Sitting outside here is very nice. On the street corner is where I bought my very first Parisian newspaper. I asked her how much it was, and then used all my energy to count aloud in french the coins I needed to pay for it. Also, the coffee is really good . If you don\'t like how strong the non-percolated coffee is in France, ask for a Cafe Americano, and they will add some water to the coffee, making it more like what we\'re used to at home. Merci et bonne chance!

properties.name: Used book sellers
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedAlong the river, lots of street vendors sell old posters, prints, lithographs, etc...You can find some really good, if dusty, used books here too.

properties.name: Work
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI work around these parts.

properties.name: somewhere in conakry
properties.description: Posted by Clayreedthis little peninsula is where i, my mail, and my luggage will land and take off for about two years
